## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r, include=TRUE, echo=TRUE}
c.data = read.csv("Covid19-FinalData.csv", header=T)
str(c.data)

c.data$Year = as.factor(c.data$Year)
c.data$Week = as.factor(c.data$Week)
head(c.data)
```


```{r, include=TRUE, echo=TRUE}

library(lme4)

#Simple lm
c.lm1 = lm(Deaths~Week+Covid+PopDensity+Population+Year+TAVG, data=c.data)
summary(c.lm1)
AIC(c.lm1)


#RE model with Intercept

c.data$Population= scale(c.data$Population, center = FALSE, scale = TRUE)
head(c.data)
c.re1 = lmer(Deaths~Week+Covid+PopDensity+Population+Year+TAVG+(1|State),
data=c.data, REML=F, control=lmerControl(optimizer="Nelder_Mead"))
summary(c.re1)
fixef(c.re1)
head(ranef(c.re1)$State, 45)
head(coef(c.re1)$State, 10)
#Histogram of random effects
hist(coef(c.re1)$State[,1], main="Intercept")


#Including Interaction term of Covid
c.re2 =
lmer(Deaths~Week+Covid+PopDensity+Population+Year+TAVG+(1+Covid|State), data=c.data, REML=F, control=lmerControl(optimizer
="Nelder_Mead"))
summary(c.re2)

fixef(c.re2)
head(ranef(c.re2)$State, 30)
head(coef(c.re2)$State, 10)

#Histogram of random effects
hist(coef(c.re2)$State[,1], main="Intercept")
#hist(coef(c.re2)$State[,2], main="Covid")

AIC(c.re1)
AIC(c.re2)


```


```{r, include=TRUE, echo=TRUE}
#poisson

c.glm_p = glm(Deaths~Week+Covid+PopDensity+Population+Year+TAVG,
data=c.data, family=poisson)
summary(c.glm_p)

print("The AIC of Poisson Log linear Model is  ")
AIC(c.glm_p)
print("The BIC of Poisson Log linear Model is ")
BIC(c.glm_p)
```


```{r, include=TRUE, echo=TRUE}
#Poisson with RE

library(lme4)
m.re1 = glmer(Deaths~Week+Covid+PopDensity+Population+Year+TAVG+(1|State),
data=c.data, family=poisson)
summary(m.re1)

print("The AIC of Poisson Log linear Model with different Intercepts is  ")
AIC(m.re1)
print("The BIC of Poisson Log linear Model with different Intercepts is ")
BIC(m.re1)



```

## Including Plots
